lead_paragraph: As alarm grows over Zika, airlines are allowing passengers to change flights or receive refunds, and some tour companies are seeing cancellations.

byline.contributor: Nic Wirtz contributed reporting from Guatemala; Rafael Matos from San Juan, P.R.; and Sol Lauria from Panama.

headline.print_headline: As Zika Concerns Grow, the Travel Industry Reacts
headline.main: How the Zika Virus Is Affecting Travel

snippet: As alarm grows over Zika, airlines are allowing passengers to change flights or receive refunds, and some tour companies are seeing cancellations.
abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention warnings against travel to areas affected by Zika virus, particularly for pregnant women or those planning a pregnancy, are bringing reactions across travel industry; number of airlines have issued statements concerning their rebooking and refund policies for travelers with reservations to impacted areas, and cruise lines are also working with customers who want to postpone or cancel travel.
